newsitem.title: UK: Britain halts 200 mln stg ships contract to VSE.
newsitem.headline: Britain halts 200 mln stg ships contract to VSE.

text.p: Britain's Defence Ministry has been forced to delay a 200 million pound ($323.4 million) shipbuilding contract to the VSEL shipyard after objections, the Financial Times said on Thursday.
The newspaper said the ministry had cancelled a planned announcement on the contract on Monday following an intervention from Scottish Secretary Michael Forsyth.
VSEL's bid for the contract, in competition with a consortium of British Aerospace and Clydeside's Kvaerner Govan yard, was said to have represented the best value for money, the newspaper reported.
But it emerged that without more work the Norwegian-owned Govan shipyard would face the threat of closure. ($1=.6184 Pound)
